intro: Acetosella tenella, commonly known as mouse ear chickweed, is a small, low-growing plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and meadows. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is known for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Acetosella tenella is also valued in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
